item.title: Qwest Embraces Ethernet over Copper to Reach Rural Business Locations
item.description:
Qwest Communications, a leading telecom provider in the US, boasts a nationwide fiber optic network capable of transmitting data at 40 Gbps, with plans to upgrade to 100 Gbps. While this caters to large enterprises requiring substantial bandwidth, what options are available for remotely located businesses? Remote offices, even those belonging to large corporations, often face challenges justifying the cost of installing fiber optic cables due to their distance from carrier Points of Presence (POPs)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/qwest-embraces-ethernet-over-copper-to-reach-rural-business-locations/
